### PR summary [565bfb166c](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/19755/commits/565bfb166ca6c6a811d8798ffc272b0a67ec389b)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

#### Declarations diff

`+ main`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>
ðŸš€ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by grunweg.

:v: kim-em can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

I merely verified that the zulip-sending logic was copied correctly. Did you test this on Windows? I recall there being an issue last time. Thanks!
maintainer delegate?

I merely verified that the zulip-sending logic was copied correctly. Did you test this on Windows? I recall there being an issue last time. Thanks!
maintainer delegate?

A preliminary comment: if you thought about this in the meantime, consider this moot:

I understand where the message comes from... but my first reaction was "but wasn't this about a bug when importing all of aesop?". What do you think about clarifying the message, to mention e.g. mathlib and aesop? (Or is it guaranteed - and not just current behaviour - that mathlib imports all of aesop? In that case, things may be fine. But when we wouldn't need to put `import Aesop` in the test either.)
New error message is clearer, thanks!

```suggestion
  IO.println "Verified that an executable importing all of Mathlib and its upstream dependencies can be built and executed."
```
The name of this executable feels slightly odd to me. I don't have an immediately better suggestion, though - and in any case, this is not so important.

pullRequest.title: feat: test that an executable with `import Mathlib` can be built and run
